title: Scrapbook (USA), 1900–15
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic, wool
Technique: various weave structures.
inscribed: 'Magasins du Louvre' on p.13 and 41. 'Arnold Constable' label on pp 49, 111, 133, 136 and 147. 'B.Altman &Co.' p.91, 'Au Printemps' p.93. 'Au Bon Marche' p.147, 'Jarroson & Laval' p.147. a dyeing card from A.B. Chambeyron & fils, St. Etienne, May 14, 1900, some style #s and weaves.
dimensions: Closed book: 35 x 32 x 7 cm (13 3/4 x 12 5/8 x 2 3/4 in. )
description: Scrapbook, assembled in New York, containing 1545 swatches of textiles and ribbons. Some examples were purchased in shops in New York and Paris, others appear to come direct from the manufacturer. Several colorways. Swatches are either pasted or pinned into book. (woven, printed and warp printed, machine embroidery)

tombstone.epitaph:
Scrapbook (USA), 1900–15. Medium: silk, metallic, wool
Technique: various weave structures.. 
1967-54-10
